title: Spicy Indian Potatoes
directions: Peel and cut potatoes into small cubes.
Add cumin seeds, onion seeds, mustard seeds and asafoetida powder to pan and shake around until seeds start to crackle.
Add potatoes, turmeric powder, salt and green chilis. Mix well.

Lower heat to simmer and cover pan for about 18-20 minutes or until the potatoes are fork tender. You may want to add a splash of water at this step if it's too dry for the potatoes to get cooked well.
Increase heat to high and stir. I let the potatoes brown a bit but you can skip this step.
Remove from heat and stir in chopped cilantro and lemon juice.
ingredients: 1⁄4 teaspoon caraway seeds (kalonji) or 1⁄4 teaspoon onion seeds (kalonji)
1 chopped green chili pepper (I used Serrano pepper)
